intro: Nashia variifolia, commonly known as the variable leaf nashia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late summer. Nashia variifolia is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value lies in its delicate foliage and subtle floral display.
